title: Raid Counters

meta.description: Find Pokemon Go raid counters with weather, friendship and even your own Pokebox. Get the 30 best counters with the world's #1 custom raid guide.

intro: Pokemon Go raids are here! Find out which Pokémon will counter raid bosses the best with the world’s most accurate custom Pokemon Go Raid Guide. Just select the raid below to see the best counters for each moveset!

articles.title: Latest Raid News!
articles.subtitle: Articles and Videos About Pokemon Go Raids From Top Players And Researchers

guide.title: Pokebattler $t(constants:pokemon.{{pokemonId}}) Raid Counter Guides
guide.subtitle: How To Defeat $t(constants:pokemon.{{pokemonId}}) in Pokemon Go
guide.article: Read The Full $t(constants:pokemon.{{pokemonId}}) Raid Counter Guide Below

RAID_LEVEL_1.title: Tier 1
RAID_LEVEL_1.subtitle: Easy Solo Raid
RAID_LEVEL_1.intro: Tier 1 raids are quite easy to defeat by yourself. A level 20 player with imperfect pokemon should be able to beat this by themselves. These raids are a good way to collect candy for pokemon that are not common in your area.

RAID_LEVEL_2.title: Tier 2
RAID_LEVEL_2.subtitle: Hard Solo Raid
RAID_LEVEL_2.intro: Tier 2 raids are targeted at level 30-40 players who can easily defeat these Pokemon. Lower level players should team up to beat these Pokemon.

RAID_LEVEL_3.title: Tier 3
RAID_LEVEL_3.subtitle: Easy Group Raid
RAID_LEVEL_3.intro: Tier 3 raids are targeted at groups of 2 level 30-40 players. They can be soloed by a level 40 player with a little luck and perfect play with awesome Pokemon.

RAID_LEVEL_4.title: Tier 4
RAID_LEVEL_4.subtitle: Hard Group Raid
RAID_LEVEL_4.intro: Tier 4 raids are targetted at groups of 5-6 level 30-40 players. Reports have come in of these Pokemon being beaten by max level players with 3-4 of the perfect counters.

RAID_LEVEL_4_5.title: Tier 4.5
RAID_LEVEL_4_5.subtitle: Easy Legendary Raid
RAID_LEVEL_4_5.intro: Tier 4.5 raids are easier versions of legendary bosses intended at groups of 2-4 level 30-40 players. They are typically seen during short duration events.

RAID_LEVEL_5.title: Tier 5
RAID_LEVEL_5.subtitle: Legendary Raid
RAID_LEVEL_5.intro: The current legendary raids are the best way to obtain strong pokemon! They are often done with groups of 6-10 level 30-40 players. Some intrepid experts have done some of these raids with as few as 2-5 players.

RAID_LEVEL_6.title: Tier 6
RAID_LEVEL_6.subtitle: Legendary Raid - Bonus Hp
RAID_LEVEL_6.intro: These raids have bonus hp compared to Tier 5 raids. It is unknown wether this is a permanent change for all Tier 5.  They are often done with groups of 6-10 level 30-40 players. Some intrepid experts have done some of these raids with as few as 3-5 players.

RAID_LEVEL_UNSET.title: Tier ?
RAID_LEVEL_UNSET.subtitle: Unknown Raids
RAID_LEVEL_UNSET.intro: These Pokemon may be parts of future Pokemon raid tiers. Use this if a new raid has come out and the site has not been updated yet. You can also use this section for analysis of what would happen if you had a legendary Magikarp raid too!

RAID_LEVEL_4_EVENTS.title: Special Tier 4
RAID_LEVEL_4_EVENTS.subtitle: Special Event Raids
RAID_LEVEL_4_EVENTS.intro: These Pokemon have been raids at past events such as Yokohama. They may come back again unannounced.

RAID_LEVEL_1_LEGACY.title: Legacy Tier 1
RAID_LEVEL_1_LEGACY.subtitle: Easy Solo Raid
RAID_LEVEL_1_LEGACY.intro: These raids are not currently in the raid rotations.

RAID_LEVEL_2_LEGACY.title: Legacy Tier 2
RAID_LEVEL_2_LEGACY.subtitle: Hard Solo Raid
RAID_LEVEL_2_LEGACY.intro: These raids are not currently in the raid rotations.

RAID_LEVEL_3_LEGACY.title: Legacy Tier 3
RAID_LEVEL_3_LEGACY.subtitle: Easy Group Raid
RAID_LEVEL_3_LEGACY.intro: These raids are not currently in the raid rotations.

RAID_LEVEL_4_LEGACY.title: Legacy Tier 4
RAID_LEVEL_4_LEGACY.subtitle: Hard Group Raid
RAID_LEVEL_4_LEGACY.intro: These raids are not currently in the raid rotations.

RAID_LEVEL_4_5_LEGACY.title: Legacy Tier 4.5
RAID_LEVEL_4_5_LEGACY.subtitle: Easy Legendary Raid
RAID_LEVEL_4_5_LEGACY.intro: These are previously seen easy legendary raid bosses.

RAID_LEVEL_5_LEGACY.title: Legacy Tier 5
RAID_LEVEL_5_LEGACY.subtitle: Legendary Raid
RAID_LEVEL_5_LEGACY.intro: These raids have been available in the past but are not currently in the raid rotations. They may return in the future for special events.

RAID_LEVEL_6_LEGACY.title: Legacy Tier 6
RAID_LEVEL_6_LEGACY.subtitle: Legendary Raid - Bonus Hp
RAID_LEVEL_6_LEGACY.intro: These raids have been available in the past but are not currently in the raid rotations. They may return in the future for special events.

RAID_LEVEL_4_5_FUTURE.title: Future Tier 4.5
RAID_LEVEL_4_5_FUTURE.subtitle: Easy Legendary Raid
RAID_LEVEL_4_5_FUTURE.intro: These are  easy legendary raid bosses that are not in the game yet. Their stats and moves are still subject to change

RAID_LEVEL_5_FUTURE.title: Future Tier 5
RAID_LEVEL_5_FUTURE.subtitle: Legendary Raid
RAID_LEVEL_5_FUTURE.intro: These tier 5 raids are not in the game yet! Their stats and moves are still subject to change.

meta.description: The best Pokemon Go {{defender}} counters are {{counter1}}, {{counter2}}, {{counter3}}, {{counter4}}, {{counter5}} & {{counter6}}. Login to see your custom results!

counters.title: counters
counters.subtitle: Best Attackers by
counters.description: The following analysis shows the Pokemon that are the strongest raiders in terms of {{sort}} against {{pokemon}}.
counters.moveSetOrderingDescription: The move sets are ordered from hardest to raid against to the easiest, make sure to check multiple, the results can vary greatly!
counters.difficultyNote: Raid bosses are much harder than a normal battle, you should consider carefully your options.

hardestMovesets.title: Most Difficult Raids
hardestMovesets.subtitle: For {{pokemon}} by {{sort}}
hardestMovesets.description: Raid difficulty can vary greatly based on the moveset of the defending pokemon!

analysis.title: About This Analysis
analysis.description: This raid analysis was based off simulating combat with a defending {{defender.pokemon}} with {{defender.cp}} CP and {{attackers}}. The simulation was run with the {{attackStrategy}} attack strategy based on the {{defenseStrategy}} simulation type. {{numSims}} simulations were performed with each possible moveset of {{defender.pokemon}} simulated against every single Pokemon with every possible moveset. The best 20 attackers with their best moveset based on {{sort}} were kept and are displayed here. You can click on any of the attackers to see the simulation that was performed and to try different movesets.

attackers.pokebox: the custom Pokemon from user #{{userId}}'s pokebox

results.description: The best Pokemon Go {{defender}} counters are {{counter1}}, {{counter2}}, {{counter3}}, {{counter4}}, {{counter5}} & {{counter6}}. Pokebattler's {{pokemon}} raid counters guide is designed to help you beat {{pokemon}} with your best counters. You can find the best counters overall to defeat {{pokemon}} in the infographic and article and use our customizable tool form for custom results showing generic Pokemon, or your own Pokemon. This guide is customizable by changing the attack level, attack strategy and sort options. You can find the best Pokemon that you own to beat {{pokemon}} if you add your Pokemon into your personal Pokebox.

patreon.description: More accurate results for unknown movesets provided thanks to the support of subscribers. Subscribers receive additional pokebox space, even higher accuracy results for all movesets and more.
patreon.link: See all the benefits you get for signing up

pokebox.login: Pokebattler Raid Guide can be customized to only include Pokemon you actually own using your own personal Pokebox. Log in, add your best Pokemon to your personal Pokebox, and then you can toggle between the best Pokemon that you have in your Pokebox, and the best Pokemon counters overall to plan your raid fights.
pokebox.enabled: Showing custom results for your Pokebox. The 30 best counters that you own are shown below.
pokebox.disabled: Showing results for level {{level}} attackers. The best 30 counters at that level are shown below.
pokebox.friend: Showing results for user {{userId}}. Their best 30 counters are shown below.

emptyResults.LEVEL: There were no results returned for this calculation. The server may be having issues.
emptyResults.POKEBOX: There were no results returned for this calculation. Perhaps you have not entered any pokemon in your pokebox yet?
emptyResults.FRIEND: There were no results returned for this calculation. Perhaps your friend has not entered any Pokemon in their pokebox yet? Try a different trainer.

people.title: Pokebattler Estimator
people.adviceLink: See what happens if you power up

estimate.close: Beating {{pokemon}} should take {{numPeople}} trainers with Pokemon of this strength. It will be a very close fight. Bring one more trainer if you can to be safe.
estimate.almost: Beating {{pokemon}} should take {{numPeople}} trainers with Pokemon of this strength. If you are very lucky, you might be able to beat it with 1 less trainer.
estimate.trivial: Beating {{pokemon}} should take {{numPeople}} trainer with Pokemon of this strength. This fight will be over before it's begun. It's so easy you could just use the in game suggestions and win.
estimate.normal: Beating {{pokemon}} should take {{numPeople}} trainers with Pokemon of this strength. Make sure your group is prepared before the fight.
estimate.difficult: Beating {{pokemon}} should take {{numPeople}} trainers with Pokemon of this strength. It will be a difficult fight, make sure everyone uses their best Pokemon.
